intro: Chordospartium muritai, commonly known as the coastal thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats. The plant features gray-green, hairy leaves and produces small, purple to pinkish flowers. It has a taproot system that helps it survive in dry, saline environments. Chordospartium muritai is known for its ability to thrive in harsh coastal conditions, making it an important part of the local flora.
